importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This date marks the 1,335th day of the Russia-Ukraine war, highlighting the prolonged and ongoing nature of the conflict.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe from February 24, 2022, to October 21, 2025, represents the full duration of the war since Russia's initial invasion, indicating sustained military and humanitarian impact.

keyTakeAways: A Russian attack on the Ukrainian border region of Chernihiv resulted in a power outage affecting parts of northern Ukraine.
The main town outside the decommissioned Chernobyl nuclear power station was among the areas impacted.
The attack occurred on Tuesday, October 21, 2025.
Officials reported the incident, and it was reported by the Reuters news agency.

namedEntities.name: Russia
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A country that launched an attack on Ukraine
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Russia is the aggressor in the conflict described, and its actions are central to the reported attack on Chernihiv.

namedEntities.name: Ukraine
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A nation experiencing military attacks from Russia
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ukraine is the target of the Russian attack and is directly affected by the power outage in its border region.

namedEntities.name: Chernihiv
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A border region in northern Ukraine
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Chernihiv is the specific location in Ukraine targeted by the Russian attack, which caused a power outage in the region.

namedEntities.name: Chernobyl nuclear power station
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A decommissioned nuclear facility located near Chernihiv
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The presence of the decommissioned Chernobyl nuclear power station provides context for the significance of the location, especially in terms of regional vulnerability and public concern.

namedEntities.name: Reuters
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Reuters reported the incident, indicating the role of international media in disseminating information about the ongoing war.

summaryOfNewsArticle: On Tuesday, October 21, 2025, a Russian attack on the border region of Chernihiv in northern Ukraine led to a power outage affecting parts of the region, including the main town near the decommissioned Chernobyl nuclear power station. The incident was reported by the Reuters news agency, underscoring the continued escalation of hostilities in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war.
title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,335
